summary: I teared up watching this video. The American mainstream media needs to watch this and ACKNOWLEDGE the fact that the reason...
caption: I teared up watching this video. The American mainstream media needs to watch this and ACKNOWLEDGE the fact that the reason ARMYs love BTS so much is not just because of their looks and talents on stage, but more than that. New ARMYs need to watch this so that they know, what they’re getting into, is not just some simple fandom.

summary: Yoongi - You try to leave him Warning - May be upsetting to some readers “Yoongi, I can’t live like this anymore! You want me to...
body:
Yoongi - You try to leave him

Warning - May be upsetting to some readers

“Yoongi, I can’t live like this anymore! You want me to just act like you’re not some sort of criminal? I’ve had enough!” You shout, slamming your hands down on the table when Yoongi tells you for the tenth time that week to ‘not worry’ about the blood on his clothes, “I’m leaving,” You tell him, voice firm,

“No, you’re not,” Yoongi says, voice as level and as calm as if he’s telling you that you’re out of milk. You splutter to a halt, staring at him in disbelief. He knocks the tap off, and allows silence to fill the room as he watches the blood he washed from his hands swirl down the drain, “You’ll get used to it over time, I know you will. But you can’t leave. Not only do you know too much, I love you,” He drawls, turning to face you as he leans back on the counter, “So, you can’t leave. I’m sorry but it’s not up for discussion,” Yoongi finishes with a tone of finality,

“Well, that’s a shame because you don’t control me. I’m still leaving and there’s nothing you can do about it,” You fire back, storming straight past Yoongi in the direction of your shared bedroom. Only, at the last second, Yoongi’s hand shoots out to grab your arm, stopping you in your spot. You huff and try to pull back. He often grabs you to try and stop you storming off, knowing that it only makes fights worse, but this is different. He won’t let go, and for the first time in your six year relationship, you look up at Yoongi with genuine fear,

“If I have to tie you down myself and take you everywhere with me until you see things my way, I will. You are not leaving me,” Yoongi growls, voice rising in volume and aggression with every word until he’s snarling at you. Whimpering, you shrink back and cast your eyes to your feet, not wanting to see in his eyes what you know is there. A few seconds pass in silence before Yoongi clears his throat and lets go of your arm, ignoring the bruises already forming. One of his fingers tucks under your chin and he tilts your face up so that you look into his eyes, “Don’t cry, now. I’m not so bad,” Yoongi whispers, once again tender and sweet. You hadn’t realised you were crying until Yoongi wipes a tear away with a finger,

“You’re a monster. Why can’t I leave?” You ask in a whisper, too scared to say it any louder. You hadn’t realised how scary Yoongi could be until this moment, and you can’t stop yourself form shaking. Yoongi coos gently, but it sounds so mocking to your ears, making you feel sick,

“No, my princess. I’m not a monster. I just care about you so much that I can’t let you leave. I promise that you’ll grow to get used to it. Lots of my friends have girlfriends who wanted to leave. I’ll introduce you to some of them,” Yoongi says, voice dripping with honey. You stare into his eyes with disbelief and terror. You don’t care what he says. This has only proved to you that much more that you need to get out of this toxicity as soon as you can, “Now, why don’t you put dinner on? I’ll help you wash up afterwards,”

Masterlist
